description: Multipurpose Infrared Sensor that detects lines or nearby objects by measuring reflected infrared light. Includes onboard RED LED indicator and adjustable sensing range via variable resistor. Suitable for line follower and obstacle avoiding robots.

specifications.dimensions: 50 x 20 x 10 mm (L x B x H)

pins.Other: Variable resistor, onboard RED LED indicator

getting_started.connection_guide: Connect VCC to 5V, GND to GND, OUT to a digital input pin on Arduino. Use jumper wires to the 3-pin header. Adjust variable resistor to set sensing range.

example_code.explaination: This Arduino sketch reads the digital output of the IR proximity sensor. When an object is detected (sensor output HIGH), it turns on an onboard LED, increments a counter, and prints the count to the serial monitor.

source_document: Silicon TechnoLabs IR Proximity Sensor Datasheet
